Posts.Content: I don't know really where to begin.  I had my first over 50 mammogram last week and have been called back for a secondary screening.  I have spoken to the nurse at Luton and she explained it really well, to see if it's a normal part of me.  She has explained what they are looking at is really small and that it could be nothing.  I go on Friday to have  the second procedures (hopefully snow permitting).  I could be working myself into worrying over nothing but st the same time none of us know.  They are comparing a scan from 2012 as well.  My poor mum died of breast cancer in 1987 so this has always been very raw for me.  I understand that all of you lovely ladies living through this are doing a fantastic and coping well.  I really just don't know how I would feel, i am welling up as I write this and it could all be ok.  Sorry if it sounds negative to all of you that are positive but I hope some of you can send me some positive vibes. Ann Thank you
Posts.Title: Follow up mammograms

Posts.Content: I know on my hearts of hearts it could be something of nothing and yet it still happen.  I will keep busy, there's knitting to be done and planning for the lessons that I teach. But Friday cannot come quick enough. Thank you Ann x
Posts.Title: Follow up mammograms

Posts.Content: Thank you so nuch, yes they are doing more X-rays, an examination and ultrasound but I have already said to my husband that if they are undecided about a biopsy, basically I will want them to do it.  I am slowly getting my head around it already and thank you to all of you that have already replied x
Posts.Title: Follow up mammograms

Posts.Content: Thank you, to say I was relieved was an understatement,it can be such a horrible disease big hugs to everyone going through this especially today xx
Posts.Title: Follow up mammograms

Posts.Content: Thank you, really does help xx
Posts.Title: Follow up mammograms

Posts.Content: I do remember when my mum died the nurse on the cancer ward said back then it was 1 in 10 that had that awful disease and years down the line it would be as much as 1 in 3/2 even.  She even told both my sister and I to check ourselves, which I have done ever since. And I will just wait and see what happens on Friday x
Posts.Title: Follow up mammograms

Posts.Content: Thank you x Night night x
Posts.Title: Follow up mammograms

Posts.Content: Thank you for the kind and positive thought from you all .  Despite the weather have managed to ge to Luton and it was all good news for me.  The nurses and doctors were really nice, apparently it was something to do with the breast tissue being squashed and I had X-rays done in different positions today x Hope you all get well in here really soon.  I have posted on Head and Neck before for my husband, so I can stick around if any of you ladies ever want someone else to talk to xxx Again your kind words were appreciated xxx Thank you xx
Posts.Title: Follow up mammograms

Posts.Content: Thank you so kind Ann x
Posts.Title: Follow up mammograms
